body:
You also need the following tests

1)For failover flag : first node acquires lock, second node acquires lock. Then first node crashes and second not gets InterruptedException while waiting in lock queue.
2)For closing lock : Closes lock on one node, checks that it is closed on second node
3)For some operations when they implemented: lockInterruptibly, tryLock, tryLock with timeout, getHoldCount, isHeldByCurrentThread, hasQueuedThreads, hasQueuedThread local node

PS may be leave old tests for reentrant lock and just tune them
PPS it will be great if you test your code coverage

try format (Ctrl-Alt-L in IDEA): CacheUtils, AbstractMatrix#getCol, SparseBlockDistributedMatrix, BlockVectorStorage, SparseDistributedVectorStorage, SparseBlockDistributedVector, SparseDistributedVector, VectorBlockEntry, DistributedBlockOLSMultipleLinearRegressionTest

MatrixUtil, AbstractMultipleLinearRegression - replace wildcard import

OLSMultipleLinearRegressionTest re-check diff, looks like whole change is just inserting empty line?
We have dropped use of Ignite cache until this issue is resolved.
@chrisheaththomas can you please state what  problem you are facing? Because I could not reproduce IGNITE-2766.
Let me also write a unit test for this code - it seems that we don't have any unit test specifically for this class.

Please consider generifying LabeledDataset by using same type parameters as of underlying LabeledVector. Per my reading of code in LabeledDatasetTest this could lead to more type safe code. Such a change would probably better be done per separate ticket, because per my trial attempt to do this it may involve quite a lot of modifications - in particular member "data" would better change from array to list
Checked with spaces in `JAVA_HOME` and `IGNITE_HOME` respectively - node starts.
Anyone could please have a look at this?
Merged to Ignite master. Will be released in Apache Ignite 2.4

So, the fix doesn't seem to work.
yep, u right ..., i don`t check case with different classloaders.
Please resolve the conflicts with master branch.
Resolved the conflicts.  Please merge if it looks good.  Thanks.

This bug actually is not being fixed by that specific PR. That PR only address the fact that the preparedStatement is reinitialized for the next item, but it doesn't address that fact that the current items needs to retry. In fact, the unit test provided in #3088 is incorrect - There are 10 items of data being processed by only assert that there are 9 items in the processed count.

Even with the patch the error still occurs - here is the sequence:

1. block around [231](https://github.com/apache/ignite/blob/6330f0bb74d6b986d040a8017f3dfbde361d5457/modules/cassandra/store/src/main/java/org/apache/ignite/cache/store/cassandra/session/CassandraSessionImpl.java#L231) throws InvalidQueryException. data item is not processed and not added to the list of future
2. prepStatEx record the exception in [251](https://github.com/apache/ignite/blob/6330f0bb74d6b986d040a8017f3dfbde361d5457/modules/cassandra/store/src/main/java/org/apache/ignite/cache/store/cassandra/session/CassandraSessionImpl.java#L251)
3. error set to keep the exception throw (line [276](https://github.com/apache/ignite/blob/6330f0bb74d6b986d040a8017f3dfbde361d5457/modules/cassandra/store/src/main/java/org/apache/ignite/cache/store/cassandra/session/CassandraSessionImpl.java#L276))
4. line [282](https://github.com/apache/ignite/blob/6330f0bb74d6b986d040a8017f3dfbde361d5457/modules/cassandra/store/src/main/java/org/apache/ignite/cache/store/cassandra/session/CassandraSessionImpl.java#L282) resets the prepStatEx to null
5. line [309](https://github.com/apache/ignite/blob/6330f0bb74d6b986d040a8017f3dfbde361d5457/modules/cassandra/store/src/main/java/org/apache/ignite/cache/store/cassandra/session/CassandraSessionImpl.java#L309) didn't check the cached "error", so the error in 231 is ignored and it will not retry and return 310
PR merged into Apache Ignite master branch
Outdated, better implementation is available in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IGNITE-7533

I know with this patch you are keeping a consistency with existing logic but why Ignite has "OR" logic? Usually system properties have precedence over configuration files. For me, "OR" over here is kind of misleading.

@amirakhmedov ,
agree with you, but changing condition checks order is not related the original issue, so, I've just left order "as is".

Looks like it is legacy-code and I doubt this property is ever useful. I'd think, at first, we should decide either to remove this option at all or fix the order, and then make any changes.
We can't drop property until next major release, so the only way for now is to make smth I suggest in PR.

Feel free to create a ticket for this.
@akuznetsov-gridgain done. I also fixed some conflicts which appeared since PR was created.

Did a rebase + merge, which produced wrong history of commits, so cherry-picked commits to another branch. The correct pull request is:
https://github.com/apache/ignite/pull/3528

I'm sorry but I can't do this issue. After strict investigation of tests results, I still see failed tests with my PR. And I truly don't understand a reason.
I found two type of unclear using of `DiscoveryDataClusterState`.

**1. Concurrency using**
`DiscoveryDataClusterState.transitionRes` + `GridClusterStateProcessor.transitionFuts` are working together like a future: `DiscoveryDataClusterState.transitionRes` used for value passing and `GridClusterStateProcessor.transitionFuts` used as a latch.

**2. Serialization**
There is logic based on the fact some fields are `transient` and some other is not. It breaks some invariants which I think I see in code (object become partly initialized).

But some bugs still here, so maybe there is something else.

I think we should make clear using of `DiscoveryDataClusterState` before this issue became resolvable.

Or maybe someone else will be lucky.
Changes were merged into Apache master branch
plz, rename checkBaselineInFromMBena and replace nonusable baselineNodes.
Looks good, but I would like to see a code comment on why do we handle enums specially.
Also I don't see test for future check in your PR. I think test in first commit wasn't unnecessary.

BTW, I applied your patch to master branch and found out that there is no changes in `CheckpointHistory` class which uses `truncate` method.
Because of this I see compilation error in my code although TC passes just fine.
Could you check please what's going on with this class?
Latest merges needed conflict resolution (inner class was put in a separate file), I guess that was the reason you were not able to compile.

Merged to master f1ecbbc87d6a42dad960cda09cbc43992ff286e1, 

Could you please close PR manually, because I forgot to mention PR name in commit?
Thanks a lot for the fix. But the problem is a bit more deeper: BinaryTypeStorage should not be shared between different IgniteClients. I'm preparing the full fix, it will be ready soon.
@nizhikov thanks for the review, I have addressed your comments now, please let me know if there's anything further
@nizhikov I've pushed test refactoring as requested; please see my other two comments and let me know how you want to proceed with regards to backwards compatibility of the table catalog.

@stuartmacd Overall looks good. I made some minor comments.

The only thing we should discuss on the dev-list is how we should form tables list.
Please, send a mail with your proposal to the ticket topic.

Also, when PR be a fully ready, please, run tests on [Ignite Team City server](https://ci.ignite.apache.org/project.html?projectId=IgniteTests24Java8) and provide a link to it in the ticket.
You may want to run following test plans:
  * [RDD](https://ci.ignite.apache.org/viewType.html?buildTypeId=IgniteTests24Java8_Rdd)
  * [Scala examples](https://ci.ignite.apache.org/viewType.html?buildTypeId=IgniteTests24Java8_ScalaExamples)

Thanks for your contribution!
@nizhikov could you take a look at this PR too please?
@nizhikov Thanks, I have sent a note to the dev list - please do add your opinion there!

Is it possible to add a test in Apache.Ignite.Core.Tests/Compute/ComputeApiTest.JavaTask.cs?
There's one for WithNoFailover().

Otherwise, looks good to me!

@stuartmacd Overall looks good! 
I left minor comments according to Ignite Code Style.

You can find whole description [here](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IGNITE/Coding+Guidelines).

Please, fix my comments and run RDD tests on Team City.
If the tests are OK, I will merge your contribution.

Thanks!

@stuartmacd As far as I can see we don't support `OPTION_SCHEMA` if `mode=Overwrite`.
In that case, Ignite will drop an existing table and create a new one. 

We should create a new table under a specified schema.

See [`IgniteReliationProvider#createRelation`](https://github.com/apache/ignite/blob/master/modules/spark/src/main/scala/org/apache/ignite/spark/impl/IgniteRelationProvider.scala#L115)

Please, add support of `OPTION_SCHEMA` to `Overwrite` mode.

@nizhikov all tables created through CREATE TABLE need to be in the PUBLIC schema (which is default on CREATE TABLE), Ignite throws an exception if you try to do anything else. See [the Ignite docs](https://apacheignite-sql.readme.io/docs/create-table)

> CREATE TABLE need to be in the PUBLIC schema

Yes, I checked it and this is true. Sorry for bad advice.

Looks like in `save` mode we should allow to specify `OPTION_SCHEMA` only for an `Append` or when table already created. 
If `OPTION_SCHEMA` is defined and table doesn't exists or mode is `Overwrite` we should throw an exception.

Also, we need to add proper explanation to the scaladoc and ignite documentation.

What do you think?

Thanks @nizhikov , I have made the changes you suggested. Here are the passing CI builds:

[RDD](https://ci.ignite.apache.org/viewLog.html?buildId=1707480&)
[Scala Exampels](https://ci.ignite.apache.org/viewLog.html?buildId=1707482&)

Please let me know if you have any further comments.

@alamar it's possible yes, but I'm a bit concerned that we are writing component tests for every minor change. It will lead to the situation with tests as in the Java code. Moreover .NET code just calls java function, which is tested on their side.
